channel.title: ByteByteGo Newsletter
channel.description: Explain complex systems with simple terms, from the authors of the best-selling system design book series. Join over 1,000,000 friendly readers.

item.title: 【How OpenAI Uses Kubernetes And Apache Kafka for GenAI】Openai如何将Kubernetes和Apache Kafka用于Genai
item.description: 【In this article, we will understand how OpenAI built such a system and the challenges they faced.】在本文中，我们将了解Openai如何建立这样的系统以及它们面临的挑战。

item.title: 【EP183: MCP vs API: what’s the difference?】EP183：MCP vs API：有什么区别？
item.description: 【APIs have been the backbone of software-to-software communication for decades.】几十年来，API 一直是软件间通信的支柱。

item.title: 【Last Call: Enrollment for the AI Engineering Cohort Ends Today】上次通话：AI工程队列的注册今天结束
item.description: 【Our very first cohort of Becoming an AI Engineer starts in one day. This is a live, cohort-based course created in collaboration with best-selling author Ali Aminian and published by ByteByteGo.】我们成为AI工程师的第一个队列从一天开始。这是与畅销书作家阿里·阿米尼亚（Ali Aminian）合作创建的，由Bytebytego出版的实时，基于队列的课程。

item.title: 【Service Discovery 101: The Phonebook for Distributed Systems】服务发现101：分布式系统电话簿
item.description: 【How do all these services find and communicate with each other in this constantly shifting landscape?】在这种不断变化的景观中，所有这些服务如何找到并相互交流？

item.title: 【How Airbnb Runs Distributed Databases on Kubernetes at Scale】Airbnb如何大规模运行Kubernetes上的分布数据库
item.description: 【In this article, we will look at how Airbnb implemented this design and the challenges they faced.】在本文中，我们将研究Airbnb如何实施这一设计及其面临的挑战。

item.title: 【Why Anthropic’s MCP is a Big Deal】为什么人类的MCP很重要
item.description: 【In this article, we will look at MCP in detail and explore what makes it such an important component in the AI landscape.】在本文中，我们将详细研究MCP，并探索使其成为AI景观中如此重要组成部分的原因。

item.title: 【How Grab’s Migration from Go to Rust Cut Costs by 70%】Grab的迁移如何从生锈削减成本70％
item.description: 【Grab has long relied on Golang for most of its microservices. In this article, we look at how Grab migrated their counter service from Go to Rust, resulting in a 70% cost reduction.】Grab长期以来一直依赖Golang的大多数微服务。在本文中，我们研究了Grab如何从Rust迁移他们的柜台服务，从而降低了70％的成本。

item.title: 【Last Chance to Enroll | Become an AI Engineer | Cohort-Based Course】注册的最后机会|成为AI工程师|基于队列的课程
item.description: 【Our very first cohort of Becoming an AI Engineer starts in less than a week. This is a live, cohort-based course created in collaboration with best-selling author Ali Aminian and published by ByteByteGo.】我们成为AI工程师的第一个队列在不到一周的时间内就开始了。这是与畅销书作家阿里·阿米尼亚（Ali Aminian）合作创建的，由Bytebytego出版的实时，基于队列的课程。

item.title: 【EP182: Cookies vs Sessions】EP182：cookie vs sessions
item.description: 【Every web app needs a way to remember users after they log in, and the way they manage this makes a big difference in performance, scalability, and security of that web application.】每个Web应用程序都需要一种方法来记住用户登录后，并且他们管理此操作的方式对该Web应用程序的性能，可扩展性和安全性有很大的影响。

item.title: 【GraphQL 101: API Approach Beyond REST】GraphQL 101：API接近休息
item.description: 【In this article, we will start with the basic concepts of GraphQL, covering how it works and why it has become so popular. From there, we will look at different ways GraphQL can be used as part of system architecture, from simple deployments to large-scale environments.】在本文中，我们将从 GraphQL 的基本概念开始，介绍它的工作原理以及它为何如此流行。从那里，我们将研究 GraphQL 作为系统架构一部分的不同方式，从简单的部署到大规模环境。
